results.title: Roman scandals
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Frank Tuttle and Samuel Goldwyn
results.brief_description: An Oklahoma farm boy dreams his way back to the glory of ancient Rome and becomes a spokesman for the oppressed Roman people, suffering under the tyrannical rule of the cruel and sneering Emperor Valerius. A musical comedy of dance and song adapted by William Anthony McGuire from the original story by George S. Kaufman and Robert E. Sherwood with songs by Harry Warren and Al Dublin and production numbers directed by Busby Berkeley. Starring Eddie Cantor and Ruth Etting with Gloria Stuart, Phillips Holmes, Edward Arnold, Alan Mowbray and The Goldwyn Girls and an appearance by Lucille Ball in her film debut as a slave girl.

results.title: Up in arms
results.creator_credit: Elliott Nugent, Samuel Goldwyn and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Wartime musical comedy about a hypochondriac elevator operator who, after being drafted into the Army, becomes a surprise hero. Infatuated with nurse Mary, Danny Weems (Danny Kaye) tries to set up his friend Joe with her friend and fellow nurse Virginia, (Dinah Shore) but Virginia is crazy about Danny and Joe and Mary fall for each other. After all four enter the Army, Danny, Joe, and Virginia discover they are being transported to the South Pacific aboard the same ship. Danny accidentally causes Mary to be smuggled aboard their ship, and spends much of the film trying to keep her hidden from the colonel. When the troops finally land, Danny is thrown in the brig, where Japanese soldiers first kidnap him and then are tricked into capture by Danny. He returns to Virginia and acclaim as a hero. Cast also includes Dana Andrews, Constance Dowling. the Goldwyn Girls.

results.title: The Fan
results.creator_credit: Edward Bianchi, Robert Stigwood and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller starring Lauren Bacall as the glamorous Broadway actress, Sally Ross. Sally has many adoring fans but amusement turns into terror when she becomes the obsession of one young man who is prepared to go to any lengths to realise his ultimate fantasy. Cast also includes James Garner, Maureen Stapleton, Hector Elizondo and Michael Biehn as “the fan”. Based upon the novel by Bob Randall.

results.title: Mr. Halpern and Mr. Johnson
results.creator_credit: Edie Landau, Ely Landau, Alvin Rakoff, HTV and Primetime Television
results.brief_description: This made for television theatre production stars two highly acclaimed actors, one British the other American, in what is a most thought provoking and intriguing piece of drama about two men and their shared love of one woman over a period of 40 years. Laurence Olivier is Joe Halpern, the husband, and Jackie Gleason plays Ernest Johnson, the man who is in love with Halpern’s wife. Written by Lionel Goldstein.

results.title: Waltz of the toreadors
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, Peter de Sarigny, Independent Artists (GB) and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Sellers plays six different characters in this raunchy World War 2 comedy set in a Parisian brothel. When the Germans march into Paris, the redoubtable Madame Grenier and her girls bid a sad farewell to her clients, and prepares to welcome the occupying Germans. It is not long before Madame and her girls are working for the resistance which earns them, at war’s end, the gratitude of a very amorous French President who presents Madame Grenier with a plague for the wall of her ‘distinguished house’. Screenplay by Wolf Mankowitz from the play by Jean Anouilh. Cast also includes Dany robin, John Fraser, Cyril Cusack, Margaret Leighton, John le Mesurier, Prunella Scales.

results.title: The Sunshine boys
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Adapted from the play by Neil Simon, this film version stars two great actors, Walter Matthau and George Burns, as the two cantankerous old-time vaudevillians who have been persuaded to reunite one more time for a television special, despite the fact that they hate each other. Also stars Richard Benjamin.

results.title: Dogpound shuffle
results.brief_description: A tender tale about two lonely wanderers, ex-vaudevillian dancer Steps (Ron Moody) and the drifting Pritt (David Soul) who goes wherever the odd job will take him. Steps is on the road looking for his missing beloved friend, Spot the dancing dog, when he first encounters Pritt. The two strike up a friendship and find themselves in a series of misadventures as they hit the road to find the missing Spot. A story for the family - one with a happy ending.

results.title: Rigoletto
results.creator_credit: Carmine Gallone, Giulio Fiaschi, Excelsa Film and Grandi Film Storici
results.brief_description: Film version of Giuseppe Verdi’s tragic opera Rigoletto shot at the Teatro Dell’opera, Rome. This tale of revenge, rape and murder stars the highly acclaimed singer, Tito Gobbi in the role of Rigoletto supported by Mario Filippesche (Duke of Mantua), Anna Maria Canali (Maddalena) and Marcella Govoni acting in the role of Gilda with Lina Pagliughi singing the role of Gilda. Features the Chorus and Orchestra of Teatro Dell’opera, Rome, conducted by Tullio Serafin. Sung in Italian.

results.title: Air Force One
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Armyan Bernstein, Gail Katz, Jonathan Shestack and Buena Vista International
results.brief_description: Cementing his status as action hero leading man, Harrison Ford plays the United States President who also happens to be a Vietnam War hero. Trapped aboard his private jet, President Marshall must display a steely reserve in the face of unhinged kidnappers. Peterson (In the Line of Fire, The Perfect Storm, Troy) ably directs this mainstream thriller that produces a tangle of twists but lacks the enormous tension generated by his classic wartime nail-biter “Das Boot”. Cast also includes Gary Oldman, Wendy Crewson, Paul Guilfoyle, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell, William H. Macy.

results.title: Betsy's wedding
results.creator_credit: Alan Alda, Louis A. Stroller, Martin Bregman and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Alan Alda, “Betsy’s wedding” is about a father (Alda) who must survive his daughter’s wedding, with all its fractious factions, complications, cost, deal making and emotional turmoil. An intermittently amusing work, with the highlight being Anthony La Paglia’s turn as a mobster’s nephew who falls for the bride’s policewoman sister. Cast also includes Joey Bishop, madeline Kahn, Molly Ringwald, Joe Pesci, Ally Sheedy.
